text: The following is a list of heads of government of Ivory Coast, officially the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire, since the country gained independence from France in 1960. Robert Beugré Mambé is the prime minister since 18 October 2023, he became prime minister after his predecessor Patrick Achi was dismissed by President Alassane Ouattara. ==List== Portrait Name Term of office Term of office Term of office Political party President Portrait Name Took office Left office Time in office Political party President 1 Félix Houphouët-Boigny 7 August 1960 27 November 1960 PDCI–RDA Himself Post abolished (27 November 1960 – 7 November 1990) 2 Alassane Ouattara 7 November 1990 11 December 1993 PDCI–RDA Félix Houphouët-Boigny 3 Daniel Kablan Duncan 11 December 1993 24 December 1999 PDCI–RDA Henri Konan Bédié Vacant (24 December 1999 – 18 May 2000) 4 Seydou Diarra 18 May 2000 27 October 2000 Independent Robert Guéï 5 Pascal Affi N'Guessan 27 October 2000 10 February 2003 FPI Laurent Gbagbo Seydou Diarra 10 February 2003 7 December 2005 Independent 6 Charles Konan Banny 7 December 2005 4 April 2007 Independent 7 Guillaume Soro 4 April 2007 13 March 2012 MPCI 7 Guillaume Soro 4 April 2007 13 March 2012 MPCI Alassane Ouattara 8 Gilbert Aké 6 December 2010 11 April 2011 FPI Laurent Gbagbo 9 Jeannot Ahoussou-Kouadio 13 March 2012 21 November 2012 PDCI–RDA Alassane Ouattara Daniel Kablan Duncan 21 November 2012 10 January 2017 PDCI–RDA 10 Amadou Gon Coulibaly 10 January 2017 8 July 2020 RDR 11 Hamed Bakayoko 8 July 2020 8 March 2021 RDR 12 Patrick Achi 8 March 2021 6 October 2023 RDR Vacant (6 October 2023 – 18 October 2023) 13 Robert Beugré Mambé 18 October 2023 Incumbent RDR ==Notes==
title: List of heads of government of Ivory Coast
